Diagnosis
	1. Mucinous adenocarcinoma of pancreas body and tail with peritoneal metastases

	Date of diagnosis
	March 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Mar 2024 Diagnostic laparoscopy with peritoneal biopsies

	Chemotherapy
	28 Mar 2024 - 25 Apr 2024 Modified FOLFIRINOX (dose reduced due to PS 2)

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with increasing peritoneal disease and ascites

	Current issues
	Increasing abdominal pain
Worsening ascites requiring weekly drainage
Decreasing oral intake
Deterioration in performance status

	Summary of consultation
	Case discussed at HPB MDT today. CT imaging from 25/4/24 shows increasing peritoneal disease with new nodules and moderate volume ascites. CA19-9 has increased from 1200 to 3500. Patient has required three ascitic drains in past 2 weeks.

First-line modified FOLFIRINOX was discontinued after 2 cycles due to clinical deterioration and radiological progression. Current PS 3.

MDT recommendations:
1. Not fit for second-line chemotherapy due to poor PS
2. Refer to palliative care team for symptom management
3. Consider permanent ascitic drain

	Further investigations
	None indicated

	Medication prescribed
	Prescribed Dexamethasone 4mg bd
Increased Oxycodone MR to 40mg bd

	Follow up
	Urgent palliative care review arranged for tomorrow
Permanent drain insertion scheduled for 3/5/24

	Required GP actions
	Please support palliative care referral
Prescribe breakthrough analgesia as required
